result.execSummary:
The defendant Tatianna M. Perkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Electric Weapon, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.295(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary. Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tatianna M. Perkins

records.addlTxt: 10:44 AM Defendant Tatianna M. Perkins in court.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Tatianna M. Perkins.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. PSI previously waived. Court orders sentence withheld, 24 months Probation with conditions, Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary, Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.  and not to possess any weapons.  Court costs due December 2 2022. Felony rights given to defendant. 60 days Credit.
Sentencing hearing on September 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

1:25 PM Defendant Tatianna M. Perkins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Shannon Murphy appeared by video for Tatianna M. Perkins.  Prosecuting attorney Alexander David Goulart in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to count one. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI waived. Bond Continued. Felony rights given to defendant. Count two is dismissed and read in.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.
